title: Melania Trump Absolutely DESTROYS Michelle Obama
text: With Donald Trump maintaining a strong lead as the Republican candidate, Americans everywhere have started to envision what the White House would look like with the Trumps in it. Naturally, there have been comparisons drawn between Michelle Obama and Melania Trump.Itês easy to see that the Trumps would be right at home in the extravagant White House, given that Donald and Melania are used to living in a luxurious home themselves.Melania is also no stranger to the spotlight. A former Slovenian supermodel, she has been in the public eye for some time and has visited and owned some of the most lavish homes in the United States.Take Trump Tower, for instance, the 68-floor building in Manhattan with incredible views of Central Park. The triplex on the top floor was designed to evoke the Palace of Versailles, with a hall of mirrors, luxurious marble with 24 carat gold and diamond accents, and ceilings hand-painted with stories from Greek myths.This is just one of the many over-the-top properties that the Trumps call home.Itês safe to say the Trumps would be a first family unlike any weêve seen before.

title: Trump DESTROYS Megyn Kelly, Walks Up To Her In The Middle Of The Debate And Hands HerÄ
text: Donald Trump has been quick to defend his businesses amid claims that Trump University was set up to scam American students.One of the more contentious moments of the most recent Republican primary debate came when Sen. Marco Rubio questioned the performance of Trump University. Megyn Kelly jumped in the attack as well, mentioning class-action lawsuits by former students and a lawsuit brought by New Yorkês attorney general.On the stage, Trump stood firm that the program was renamed Trump Entrepreneur Initiative before closing in 2011, and had earned an –A” rating from the Better Business Bureau.–The rating from the Better Business Bureau was a D minus,” Kelly fought back.–It was elevated to an A,” he repeated, time and time again.After the televised portion of the interaction was over, Trump left the stage to hand a fax to Fox Newsê Bret Baier during a commercial break.Trump handed a fax to the @FoxNews anchors during the #GOPDebate just a bit ago pic.twitter.com/EvVbvFZAgK ã Independent Journal (@INJO) March 4, 2016Hereês what Trump reportedly handed the moderators.

title: California Muslim Threatens Donald Trumpês Life, Then THIS Happens
text: When 23-year-old Emadeldin Elsayed made claims that he intended to kill GOP frontrunner Donald Trump, he probably didnêt see this coming.–I am willing to kill Donald Trump and serve a life sentence,” Elsayed wrote on his Facebook page, according to his attorney Hani Bushra. –The whole world would thank me for doing that.”He was arrested shortly thereafter, on February 12 at the Los Angeles area flight school he was attending. Federal agents maintain that his post qualifies as a death threat.Authorities did not file any criminal charges against Elsayed, but an immigration judge ordered that he be deported on grounds that the flight school had terminated his enrollment. As such, his student visa was no longer valid.The judge also refused to release Elsayed on bail, given that prosecutors argued he posed a flight risk. A hearing on the deportation proceedings is schedule for later this week.At this point, all Elsayed is asking for is time to get his affairs together before leaving the country.

title: Last Night Fox News Debate Was Set Up To Kill Trump, This Is The Clear Evidence
text: During the last Republican debate, Fox News made it abundantly clear that the so-called –fair and balanced” network had it out for Donald Trump. In fact, it seems they are doing everything they can to stand behind Marco Rubio.Chris Wallace, Bret Baier, and Megyn Kelly went after Donald Trump in almost every way imaginable, still trying to maintain a guise of neutrality.It was clear, however, that Trump was up against challenges that none of the other candidates faced. Trump had to answer questions about past video statements, and his rivals were repeatedly given the opportunity to attack him.A few times, Wallace and Kelly went after Trump directly, debating with him instead of sticking to their roles a moderators. This is unlike anything weêve ever seen.Kelly even compared Trump to Berne Madoff, and used leaked rumors about an off-the-record interview with Trump to underline suspicions about inconsistency.What do you think? Are you tired of this clear bias in the media?

title: BREAKING: Trump Just Got Dealt Some Devastating NewsÄ He Needs Your Support
text: According to recent reports, a New York court just ruled that a fraud suit against Donald Trump from New Yorkês attorney general can move forward. The move has since been criticized by Trumpês attorneys as being –politically motivated.”Reuters reports that on Tuesday, the four-judge panel ruled that the multi-million dollar lawsuit against Trump University could proceed. That will likely be a major distraction to Trumpês campaign during the electionãand its already giving his opponents something to target.Trump University was a program designed to teach students about the real estate investment strategies that Trump used to obtain his wealth. Courses used to cost up to $35,000, though the school stopped accepting enrollees in 2010.The lawsuit alleges that those who were enrolled in the school were offered a –bait-and-switch” where they were lured into higher-priced courses.This preliminary ruling is controversial because it establishes that the state doesnêt need to prove an intent to defraud in order to win the judgment against the GOP frontrunner. On top of that, it moved the statue of limitations back to 2007 from 2010 for those who were allegedly victims of wrongdoing.–Todayês decision is a clear victory in our effort to hold Donald Trump and Trump University accountable for defrauding thousands of students,” Attorney General Eric Schneiderman argued of the $40 million lawsuit. Not surprisingly, Schneiderman is a Democrat.Of course, Trumpês competitor Marco Rubio was quick to jump on the information, claiming during a Minneapolis rating that the courtês decision –validated the attacks” that he has made on the legendary businessman over Trump University.–What he did to those people is what he is doing to those people is what he is doing to Americans now,” he concluded.Trumpês lawyers have publicly come to his defense.–We think all these claims are without merit and baseless,” Alan Garten, general counsel for Trump Organization commented. –Ninety-eight percent of those who participated in the programs filled out written surveys giving the programs the highest grades.”Watch the interaction between Rubio and Trump below and tell us what you think. Is this lawsuit politically motivated?

title: PUNISHMENT: Fox Gets Devastating News After Losing War Against Trump
text: According to a new survey, Fox News is paying dearly for their anti-Trump bias and battles with the GOP front-runner. Their antics have had an impact on the opinions of their Republican viewers.–By mid-February, FNCês perception by Republican adults 18 and over had reached its lowest point in more than three years, and has declined by approximately 50 percent since January of this year,” YouGov Brand Index reported on Wednesday of last week.The decline began shortly after Donald Trump climbed to the top of the primary polls at the end of last summer. It also coincided with the feud between the legendary businessman and Fox News debate moderator Megyn Kelly.The networkês –Buzz” score dropped by 11 points, from 49 to 38. Now, itês sitting at a record low of 14. And itês rival network CNNês is taking advantage of the dip, now overlapping Fox Newsê score.Breitbart attributes this change to CNNês ability to –outclass” Fox and their willingness to handle the debates in an –infinitely more professional, unbiased and fair” manner.What do you think? Did Fox News make a mistake in attacking Trump?

title: Donald Trump Just Got The Best News Of His Life
text: For the first few months of his campaign, the GOP establishment maintained that frontrunner Donald Trump was a –passing fad.” It was widely believed that he would not win the nomination.That is all about to change.According to The Washington Post, Trump is on track to win the 1,237 delegates he needs by the end of the primaries to claim the Republican nomination. Before Nevada, he held a strong lead with 67 delegates.In comparison, Ted Cruz has 11, Marco Rubio has 10, John Kasich has five, and Ben Carson has three.Now, Trump received an additional dozen delegates in Nevada, giving him 79 total.Trump is expected to receive half of the winner-take-all delegates, and about 30% of the additional 618 delegates are given a hybrid process between winner-take-all and proportional allocation. That is a total of 412 delegates.What do you think? Will Trump win the Republican nomination?

title: 1 Tweet Could Spell The End Of Cruz And RubioÄ Trump Is Definitely Smiling
text: GOP front-runner Donald Trump has made it clear that he believes he has the support of Latino voters, even though liberals have repeatedly tried to claim that he has distanced himself from them. Now, the numbers are starting to back up Trumpês assertion.In fact, Trumpês stance on immigrant didnêt prevent him from winning the Republican Latino vote in Nevada. He won 45% of the vote, while Cruz won 29 percent and Rubio took just 18 percent.Trumpês competitors and critics are now scratching their heads, wondering just how many votes he might actually receive from the Latino community.Support continues to surface, and tweets like the one below from Cuban-American Eduardo Gonzalez show that Trump has clearly tapped into a powerful set of voters."It's the first time we voted in a caucus," said Eduardo Gonzalez, a Cuban-American who voted for Trump rather than the two Cuban-Americans ã Tim Mak (@timkmak) February 24, 2016This could also been trouble for Rubio and Cruz, who were in many ways counting on securing the Latino vote.Of course, itês important to note that the sample size of Latinos in Nevada was very small, but the results are interesting nonetheless.What do you think? Do you support Trump and his policies on immigration?

title: Tom Brady Fans Are FURIOUS After He Does THIS For Trump
text: There is one thing you can definitely say about GOP front-runner Donald Trump: heês got friends in high places. And a lot of those friends seem to be professional athletes.In fact, some of the biggest names in sports have announced their support for Donald Trump as President of the United States.–If you want to get this city out of a dump, you better vote on Trump. OK?” Boxer Mike Tyson told WNYW.–Heês an underdog and no one likes the fact that he is winning,” Tyson continued. He has never endorsed a candidate before. –I know Trump. This is a good thing. Vote on Trump.”Former BNA star Latrell Sprewell has also expressed his support of the legendary businessman, as has NFL Hall of Fameês Herschel Walker.–Thereês not a doubt in my mind right now he is my front-runner,” the NFL star told USA TODAY. –Iêm not going to say anything negative about him because itês not true.”Former Chicago Bears Coach Mike Ditka has also endorsed Trump, telling the Chicago Sun-Times that he has –the fire in his belly to make America great again and probably do it the right way.”Topping the list of professional athletes who plan to vote for Trump is Tom Brady of the New England Patriots.–Donald is a good friend of mine,” he commented. –I support all my friends in everything they do. I think itês pretty remarkable what heês achieved in his life.”What do you think? Would you vote for Trump?

title: Mexican President To Trump: •We Wonêt Pay For That F***ING Wallê
text: Perhaps one of the most controversial proposals that GOP front-runner Donald Trump has put forth is for a wall along the U.S. _ Mexico border.Now, Former Mexican President Vincente Fox is shooting down his plan by arguing that he wonêt be chipping in for any part of the structure.–Iêm not going to pay for that f***ing wall!” he told Jorge Ramos in an interview for Fusion. –He should pay for it. Heês got the money.”Fox says he is almost certain that Americans will not elect Trump to the White House, but he concerned about the results in the Nevada caucus, which showed him winning 44 percent of the Hispanic vote.–I would like to know who those Hispanics are, because they are followers of a false prophet,” Fox concluded. –Heês going to take them to the desert, and if they think that they will benefit with an administration led by Donald Trump, theyêre wrong. They must open their eyes. Please, you Hispanics in the U.S.ãopen your eyes.”–This nation is going to fail if it falls into the hands of a crazy man,” he concluded.Fox was the Mexican president from 2000 to 2006, so his comments should not be taken as policyãbut they likely have some bearing on the attitude of the current president. In fact, Felipe Calderon, his successor, has also argued that he will not pay for a border wall.What do you think? Do you believe Trump will build his wall?

title: BREAKING: Trump Engulfed In MASSIVE Rape Scandal
text: The campaign is getting ugly. The countless allegations of sexual misbehavior and assault of Hillary Clintonês husband have resurfaced. Now, something from Trumpês past is coming back to haunt him.Years back, in a $125 million lawsuit, a woman accused Trump of trying to –rape” her. Now, Jill Harth has come forward to say that she would vote from Donald Trump as president.–I saw him recently, and he said I looked good,” Harth told reporters. –I have nothing but good things to say about Donald.”Harth originally filed the lawsuit in 1997, when her then-husband George Houraney was engaged in a legal battle with Trump over a beauty pageant. Trump denied all of the charges against him in the court action, and argued that the matter was tied directly to an attempt to get him to settle in the pageant case.The lawsuit, which asserted that Trump made unwelcome sexual advances and fordicbly attempted to have sex with her in a bedroom at a Mar-A-Lago resort, was dropped shortly after being filed.Now, Harth has acknowledged that the allegations she made in her filing had been made –under duress” and that sheêd been –pressured” to file.–The allegations were twisted and embellished,” she told reporters. –Everything could be looked at in a different way.”–Unfortunately, Jill was a pawn in a lawsuit that was created by her ex-husband,” attorney Michael Cohen told reporters. –You will see the case was voluntarily dismissed without prejudice. There is no truth to it. Unfortunately, Jill was a pawn in a lawsuit that was created by her ex-husband. There is no validation to the matter and to write something about this nonsensical speculation, when both parties acknowledge there is no validity to the claim, would be unprofessional.”What do you think? Do you support Trump?

title: They Thought They Could Take Advantage Of Mrs. TrumpÄ Big Mistake [VIDEO]
text: Ever since legendary businessman Donald Trump entered the GOP primary race in June, he has made it clear that he is focused on stopping illegal immigration into the United States. There is no question that he has sparked a heated conversation in the topic.Now, Trump has scored victories in the New Hampshire and South Carolina primaries and in the Nevada caucuses. Many believe that he will be the Republican candidate for President of the United States, which means that there is a good chance that we will see in the Trumps in the White House.Accordingly, potential First Lady Melania Trump has caught the attention of the American public. Recently, she appeared on MSNBCês –Morning Joe” for an interview, where she defended her husbandês comments on immigration.It should be noted that she is an immigrant herself.Melania, who is originally from Slovenia and has since become a legal citizen, claims that her husband was bashed for weeks after he announced his campaign. Eventually, she argued, leaders began to acknowledge that he was correct in many of his beliefsãand the fact that he is not afraid to talk about top issues for many Republican voters.–Youêre an immigrant,” Mika Brzezinski asked Melania in the interview. –Do you ever think heês gone too far?”–I followed the law,” Melania concluded, articulating the process she had to go through to become a legal immigrant and obtain citizenship in 2006. She then argued that it never even crossed her mind to stay in the United States without papers.What do you think? Do you applaud Melania for standing up for her husband?

title: Bernie Sanders Slams Trump For Being Racist, So Trump Responds With THIS
text: Democratic candidates Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders tackled the issues of race at a CNN town hall meeting, just days before the South Carolina Democratic primaryãwhich has a significant number of African-American voters.During the appearance, Sanders accused Donald Trump of fomenting a –racist effort” to downplay President Barack Obamaês credibility.–We have been dealing in the last seven years with an unprecedented level of obstructionism against President Obama,” Sanders told the audience. This comes after Clinton accused Sanders of not being –sufficiently supportive” of the President.Clinton also chimed in the conversation, claiming that there are racial barriers that –we need to be honest about.” She then went on to ask a group of African-American women in the audience who had supposedly –lost their children to police action and random gun violence” to stand and be recognized.–We have serious challenges and I think it is important for people, and particularly for white people, to be honest about those,” Clinton told the audience. –Otherwise, we are never going to be the nation we should be, we are never going to overcome our legacy.”Letês just take a moment to acknowledge the irony of Hillary Clinton talking about honesty. Clearly, she was attempting to reach African-American voters. Meanwhile, she was busy side-stepping questions about her numerous contributors on Wall Street.–We have spent a lot of time talking with voters in the last week about the barriers they felt did impede their getting ahead,” Clinton argued.In a similar vein, Bernie spoke of the –wonderful people” he has met on the trail.–If I ever let those people down, it would be a terrible, terrible thing,” Bernie concluded.What do you think? Would both of these candidates be a disaster for our country, despite what they say?

title: Donald Trump Just Got Some Terrible NewsÄ Please Prey
text: Accord to recent reports, Donald Trump is now leading the GOP race by an increasingly smaller margin. To makematters worse, Marco Rubio recently picked up three key endorsements from establishment Republicans.The Daily Caller reports that Sen. Thom Tillis of North Carolina, former Minnesota Gov. Tim Palenty, and Rep.Cresesnt Hardy of Nevada have all gone public in their support of Rubio. Their announcements came shortly afterRubio took second place behind Trump in South Carolina.–Like myself, Marco came from humble beginnings and worked very hard to get to where he is today,” Tillis said inhis statement. –Marco lived the American dream. Iêm supporting Marco Rubio for president because he has anunmatched ability to inspire and uplift the American people.”–I think it comes down to this,” Pawlenty began on CNNês New Day. –Heês strong, heês also informed, heêsconservative, and heês electable, and he can unite the party. You canêt ask for much more than that. I think heês gotthe total package, and I think heês going to bring forward the strongest voice, the strongest image, and really themost thoughtful and informed strong view about how to move this country forward from a conservativeperspective.”Hardy also announced his support during a public rally on Sunday night.–I think Marco is the right guy,” Hardy commented. –The right person for me. I think he is the right person for thisstate. And I think he is the right person for this country.”What do you think of Rubio as the GOP candidate?

title: Trump Questions Obama About Scaliaês Funeral
text: Donald Trump has made a reputation for himself by bluntly speaking his mind, and heês making its clear that heês not going to hold backãeven if that means insulting President Barack Obama in front of millions.This week, it was reported that Obama would be missing Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia for reasons that were not revealed.Trump was not thrilled that the leader of our country couldnêt even show respect to someone who had helped to shape our history.–I wonder if President Obama would have attended the funeral of Justice Scalia if it were held in a Mosque?” Trump tweeted. –Very sad that he did not go!”What do you think? Do you agree with Trump? Are you tired of Obamaês blatant disrespect?

title: The Reason Why Trump Never Buttons His Suit Jacket
text: According to reports from Donald Trumpês former senior advisor Roger Stone, the GOP frontrunner does not button up his jacket during public appearances because he is wearing a bullet proof vest.Conservative talk show host Larry Elder prompted the reveal when he asked why Trump went with the unbuttoned look, claiming he had never seen that with a bullet proof vest before.Stoneês response is not what Elder was expecting, but it is no surprise given the volume of death threats that Trump has received since he entered the race. Those threats escalation shortly after he made his notorious comments on Muslim immigration.The protective measure also became a necessity after reports that drug lord El Chapo had put a $100 million bounty on his head.What do you think? Is it sad that it has to come to this? Do you support Trump?

title: Trump Reveals Who He Wants To Replace Justice Scalia
text: In a recent appearance on NBCês –Meet the Press,” Donald Trump claimed that if he were president, he would pick a replacement for Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia that was –just like Justice Scalia.”–Look, we need great intellect,” he told reporters. –We need, I think absolutely conservative. But the realãI think the real plan forward would be somebody just like Justice Scalia.”Trump also argued that his fellow candidates, Texas Sen. Ted Cruz and Florida Gov. Jeb Bush, are partially responsible for Chief Justice John Roberts, who was nominated as a conservative but ultimately upheld the Affordable Care Act.–You look at where a guy like Ted Cruz pushed very hard for Justice Roberts,” Trump commented. –Everyone thought that was wonderful.”–And Justice Roberts let everybody down by approving Obamacare twice,” he continued. –I mean, he really did let us down. And thatês largely Cruzês fault and the Bushes fault, because they put the wrong guy in there. That was a shocking decision.”Do you agree with Trump?

title: Donald Trump Calling For A Ban Of This Major Brand
text: According to reports from Fox Business, Donald Trump has just called for a massive boycott of Apple. The call to action comes after the company refused to unencrypt iPhones used by the San Bernardino shooters.There is no doubt that the phones could provide investigators with serious insight into the terror plot, but many have criticized the request for its privacy implications and the precedent it might set in the future.–First of all, Apple ought to give the security for that phone,” Trump told attendees at a rally in South Carolina on Friday. –What I think you ought to do is boycott Apple until such time as they give that security numberÄwho do they think they are?”What do you think? Do you agree with Trump or is his request unrealistic?

title: Ivanka Trump Defiantly Defends Her Dad
text: Donald Trump has been criticized relentlessly by the media, and his character has come into question time and time again.Now, his daughter Ivanka Trump is coming to her fatherês defense, speaking from the viewpoint of a wife and mother herself.–Iêve seen him in the capacity obviously as a father, and a very loving one, and also as an incredible executive who built an amazing company,” she told reporters. –And he really is remarkable.”–Ultimately, I think the testament to any person is their track record and thatês not just their professional track record, of which his is well know, he is enormously accomplished, heês employed tens of thousands of people, heês achieved success in multiple industries at the highest level,” Ivanka continued.Reporters at Breitbart then asked why she believed her father would put himself through the –wringer of the politics of personal destruction?”–A lot of people who run for elected office are looking for a platform you know and itês the next step in a political career so they donêt have that much to lose in the national awareness,” she began. –My father had that. He has an amazing life and heês built an incredible company and really heês doing this for the reasons heês articulated. I mean he canêt stand back and watch whatês happening to this country anymore, and heês been saying this for a long time.”–And heês been saying this for a long time, and heês been seeing it happen,” she continued. –So what heês doing is incredibly difficult, itês incredibly selfless you know, it takes a lot to want to enter this arena, and it is definitely a blood-sport as weêre seeing. But you know, win, lose or draw heês got a family who loves himãwhoês incredibly proud of him.”–The energy and the passion that heês elicited, you were talking about in the beginning about sort of leadership and his viewpoint on different issuesãfrom day one my father set the agenda for what the whole party is talking about and really politics in general across parties,” she concluded.What do you think? Do you applaud Ivanka for standing up for her father? Are you tired of the media trying to paint Trump as a villain?

title: Obama Insults Trump
text: President Obama took his agenda to a new level when he recently said that he does not believe that GOP frontrunner Donald Trump will make it to the White House.–I continue to believe Mr. Trump will not be president,” Obama said at a press conference in Rancho Mirage, California. –And the reason is because I have a lot of faith in the American people.”Obama then went on to claim that he believes that Americans still see the presidency as a –serious job.”–Itês not hosting a talk show, or a reality show,” he continued (which is a bit ironic given his numerous appearances on talk showsãbut we digress). –Itês not a promotion. Itês not marketing. Itês hard and a lot of people count on us getting it right.”Itês hard to believe that Obama can possibly maintain that he has gotten it right, but his ego clearly has gotten the best of him. He went on to criticize the rest of the GOP, claiming that –foreign observers are troubled” by the GOPês rhetoric. Specifically, he argued, they are concerned about Republicans doubting climate change and making proposals to ban Muslims.Trump was quick to fire back at Obama, claiming that he has done a –lousy job.”–He has set us back so far, and for him to actually say that is a great compliment, if you want to know the truth,” Trump commented in South Carolina.Sorry, Obama. Weêd take any of the GOP candidates over you any day. What do you think of his comments?

title: Trump Critisizes Obama In Time Of Tragedy
text: GOP front-runner Donald Trump has proved time and time again that he is not afraid to call it like he sees it.Recently, he took to the stage to criticize President Barack Obamaês response to a mass shooting at the hands of Islamic terrorists.Less than four hours after the incident occurred, President Obama was on live television pushing his anti-gun agenda and encouraging Americans to embrace the Muslim population. In fact, he argued that the incident was a case of –workplace violence” instead of terrorism.–We have a president that refuses to use the term,” Trump told reporters. –He refuses to say it. Thereês something going on with him that we donêt know about.”–Radical Islamic terrorism,” Trump concluded.Watch the video below and tell us what you think. Do you agree with Trump?

title: All Of Fox News Welcome Donald Trump On The Air
text: Fox Newsê –All-American New Year” is set to be hosted by Kimberly Guilfoyle.In a recent interview, Guilfoyle promoted the special by revealing that there will be many celebrity appearancesãincluding one by GOP frontrunner Donald Trump.–A lot of your favorites that people love on Fox News that are super entertaining,” she told the IJ review. –Theyêre all gonna be there all hands on deck.”The event is going to be co-hosted by Guilfoyleês co-host on The Five, Eric Bolling. It will also feature familiar personalities like Tom Shillue, Sherrod Small, Bernard McQuirk, and Joanne Nosuchinsky. Lissa –Kennedy” Montgomery, Jesse Waters, and Kat Timpf will also be present.While Guilfoyle claims that all presidential candidates on both the Republican and Democratic sides were given invitations, only a few accepted.–Youêll also have Ben Carson live,” she commented. –And weêve got some shout outs fromÄothers on the campaign trail so weêre excited about that.”What do you think of the line up?

title: Trump Goes NUCLEAR on Jeb Bush, Thereês No Taking THIS BackÄ
text: Donald Trump and Jeb Bush had it out at the most recent Republican presidential debate. They discussed going to war with ISIS, and how big of a priority it should be.–Jeb is so wrong,” Trump said, receiving boos in response. He then went on to attack Bushês family. –They lied! They said there were weapons of mass destruction,” he said. –There were none and they knew there were none!”Bush got defensive, arguing that Trump shouldnêt be focusing on his family. –Iêm sick and tired of him going after my family!”Then Marco Rubio stepped in. –I just want to say, at least on behalf of me and my family, I thank God all the time it was George W. Bush in the White House on 9/11, and not Al Gore,” Rubio said to the cheers of the crowd. I think you can look back in in hindsight and say a couple of things, but he kept us safe. And not only did he keep us safe, but no matter what you want to say about weapons of mass destruction, Saddam Hussein was in violation of U.N. resolutions, in open violation, and the world wouldnêt do anything about it,” he added. –George W. Bush enforced what the international community refused to do and again, he kept us safe, and I am forever grateful for what he did.”Do you agree with Trump or Bush?

title: Ex-Candidateês Operative Start Anyone But Trump Smear Campaign
text: The race for president has gotten increasingly ugly as we draw closer to election dates. The comments and campaigns weêre seeing between candidates are more aggressive than any weêve seen beforeãwhich in large part is due to the rift between Donald Trump and the Republican establishment.Now, a mysterious Super PAC with ties to Mitt Romney has started a campaign aimed to ensure that Trump does not secure the GOP nomination.The group, which calls itself –Our Principles PAC” is headed by former Mitt Romney campaign manager, Katie Packer. The campaign is built on the idea that Trump is a –RINO” or –Republican in Name Only.”The organization hopes to give momentum to its –anyone but Trump” message, and ultimately derail the support heês gotten by changing the public opinion against him.Packer has been transparent in their support of Marco Rubio, but she maintains that she is not in any way affiliated with his campaign. She made headlines after Trumpês defeat in Iowa when she posted a clip from Hollywood action film –Predator” with the caption: –If it bleeds we can kill it.”The tweet has since been removed, but Packer remains under question. She has refused to disclose who is financing the group that is spending million dollars to advance its message.What do you think of the campaign?

title: Trump Responds To Mexican President About Wall
text: Even before he has been elected president, Donald Trump is negotiating with Mexican officials regarding a wall on the U.S. southern border. The move proves that he is serious about moving forward with his plans if elected.According to recent reports from CNBC, when former Mexican President Felipe Calderon was asked about Mexico helping to fund the wall, he said: –Mexican people, we are not going to pay any single cent for such a stupid wall! And itês going to be completely useless.”–Now the wall just got taller,” Trump quickly responded.Of course, Calderon is the former presidentãso his opinion should not be taken as final. His comments are probably only a reflection of his personal beliefs on the matter.–The first loser of such a policy would be the United States,” Calderon continued. –If this guy pretends that closing the borders to anywhere either for trade (or) for people is going to provide prosperity to the United States, he is completely crazy.”That comment shows just how little Calderon actually knows about Trumpês proposal, which does not include anything about a final shutdown of the southern border. In fact, Trump has offered a warm welcome to anyone who wants to come into the country legally.Now, the legendary businessman has come out with an $8 billion price tag for the wall, which will be 35-40 feet high and stretch a thousand miles.Watch the interview below and tell us what you think.

title: Donald Trump Talks To Paula Jones At Rally
text: There is no doubt that Hillary Clintonês campaign has shifted into panic mode. Not only did she lose in New Hampshire to Bernie Sanders, but now one of Billês former mistresses has come forward with her endorsement of Donald Trump.According to reports, Paula Jones was spotted talking to Trump after he delivered his speech in Arkansas. title: Trace Adkins Worked For Years With Trump, Heês Finally Revealed THIS About Him

text: Jesse Watters had a quick interview with Trump where he discussed smoking, drinking, and drugs. title: Airlines Refuse To Fly This Dying Child For Treatment, Then Trump Shocks The World By Doing THIS

title: Iowa Caucus-Attendee And Trump Supporter Post Raises Questions
text: According to recent reports, a new post on social media has raised questions about potential cheating in the Iowa caucus.Tina Hessel sparked controversy when she took to Facebook with the following message:NBC also reported that Cruzês supporters used a similar tactic to take town Dr. Ben Carson.–I was reasonably happy today, until I, you know, discovered the dirty tricks going on,” Carson said on Monday night. –Spreading rumors I had dropped out.”The campaign told MSNBC that they had –confirmed reports” of Cruz supporters telling voters that Carson had dropped out of the race.–Thatês the reason I got into this race, looking at the level of deceit and distrust going on in the country,” Carson concluded.Carsonês campaign has called out a tweet from Rep. title: Ex-Trump Employee Comes Forward With Accusations Against Former Boss
text: According to recent reports, the former field manager for Donald Trumpês campaign and Miss Iowa beauty pageant contestant Elizabeth Mae Davidson has just accused the campaign of sex discrimination just prior to the Iowa caucuses.The 26-year-old claims that Trump paid female employees significantly less than male employees in the same position. She was paid $2,000 a month as a part-time staffer in addition to her work as a paralegal. Contrastingly, Davidson notes that colleagues were being paid between $3,500 and $4,000.In her filing against Trump, Davidson claimed that she was ultimately fired from the position because of –disparaging comments about senior campaign leaders to third parties” and for breaking a nondisclosure agreement.–My people tell me she did a terrible job,” Trump said of Davidson. In an interview with the Daily Mail, he argued that Davidson –made up” her claims, saying that the damage comment is not even something he would say.–It isnêt even in my vocabulary,” Trump argued. –I mean I might say someone is attractive, but thatês just not a phrase I would ever use. Itês not true. I have no idea who this woman is. Where do they find these people?”What do you think? Do you believe Trump or does this jeopardize his campaign?

title: Trump Under Fire For Allegedly Donating To Clinton Campaign, Until He Reveals THIS

title: Donald Trump Silences Reporter Who Challenged Him On Abortion Comment [VIDEO]
text: Recently, Donald Trump was quick to call out a reporter who attempted to misrepresent his previous stance on abortion during the news conference in which Trump announced that he was not going to attend the Republican debate.MSNBC reporter Peter Alexander attempted to press Trump on his Republican ideology, specifically his shift from being pro-choice to pro-life.–In 1999 you said that you were pro-choice in all respects,” Alexander began, but Trump was quick to fire back.–What did I say? You didnêt read it. Read the full statement of what I said,” Trump demanded in front of the entire room.Dodging the request, Alexander asked Trump if he would consider himself to be •trustworthy.ê–Very trustworthy, more so than you,” Trump concluded. –Because you know what, you didnêt read the question.”Alexander then looked at his notes and stammered: –Iêll read it out: •Iêm very pro-choice, I hate the concept of abortion.ê”For the record, Trumpês entire comment was –I hate the concept of abortion, I hate it, I hate everything it stands for, I cringe when I listen to people debating the subject, but still I am very pro-choice.”You can watch the clip below to watch the incident unfold.

title: Donald Trump Calls Out Bill OêReilly For Ambushing Him

title: Trump Bows Out Of The Debate Because Megyn Kelly Is Moderator
text: If you havenêt heard by now, you should know that presidential front-runner Donald Trump has just announced that he will not be participating in todayês debate.The announcement fuels an escalating feud between the legendary businessman and the Fox News Channel. title: Teacher And Fellow Students Target 11 Year Old Boy For Supporting Trump
text: According to recent reports, an 11-year-old boy named –Matthew” from Raleigh, North Carolina was publicly reprimanded after expressing his support for GOP front-runner Donald Trump during a class assignment.Matthew called conservative talk show host Rush Limbaugh last week to talk about the incident, which occurred at his liberal private school. title: Trump Responds To Priest Who Criticized Him During Sermon
text: Donald Trump is no stranger to criticism, but he probably wasnêt expecting a sermon to be directed at him while he was in church.According to the Associated Press, that is exactly what happened at the First Presbyterian Church in Iowa recently. title: 11-Year-Old Is Attacked In Liberal School For Unwavering Support Of Donald Trump
text: Recently, Matthew from Raleigh, North Carolina, encountered a despicable situation at his liberal school. What was it for? Being a proud supporter of Donald Trump.In an interview with Rush Limbaugh, Matthew fully explains the situation:RUSH: Matthew in Raleigh, North Carolina. We have an 11-year-old on the phone. Matthew, itês great to have you with us. How are you this afternoon?MATTHEW: Oh, hello, Mr. Rush, Mr. Limbaugh. Iêm here to tell youÄ Iêm 11 years old, and I go to an extremely liberal private school in Raleigh, North Carolina.RUSH: (chuckling)MATTHEW: No, I mean, likeÄ No, itês terrible. So Iêm being targeted ãRUSH: No, no. No, Matthew. Iêm justÄ Youêre 11 years old and youêre talking about this the way adults do. I find it charming. I think itês great.MATTHEW: Iêm a huge Trump supporter, and Iêm very outward about it. I like how heês going to close the borders. I like how heês gonna obliterate ISIS. Well, a few days ago ã people are still charging me ã the teacher wrote on the board, –Beside Martin Luther King, who are some visionaries who are in the world?” People wrote down Abraham Lincoln. People wrote down Rosa Parks. People wrote down Pope Francis. And I wrote down Donald Trump. And the next day, the teacher pulled me over and said, –Erase that comment!” And I was like, –Why?” And sheês like, –What good has he done for this world?”Iêm like, –Well, heês created his businesses, and heês built magnificent buildings in many countries in the world, and heês actually running for president while heês actually stating his ideas.” And I wasÄ And she made me erase it. Iêm thinking like, –Wait, why isÄ? I thought I had freedom of speech. I mean, an anchor baby gets citizenship. Why donêt I?” I kind of got mad after that. And people are targeting me, theyêre saying, –Donald Trumpês sucks and you do too,” and I really donêt know what to do.RUSH: (chuckles) Matthew, part of me is saying, –Join the club.” (laughing and clapping) Join the club.This is absolutely ridiculous, and downright unacceptable. What we will say is that Matthew is an exceptionally smart kid, and no matter the adversity he faces in life, he will make it. title: Whoopi Goldberg Says She Might Leave The Country If Trump Is Elected
text: ABCês –The View” host Whoopi Goldberg has made it more than clear that she doesnêt like Donald Trump. Thatês not the president I want. Find a way to make stuff work. Stop blaming everybody because all of this, as American citizens, this is ourãwe did all of this. Weêve allowed all this stuff, so we have to fix it.”–But you canêt say, •Oh, youêre Lebanese or youêre black or youêre Mexican or youêre a woman,” she continued. –Stop blaming everybody. Letês fix the crap. Letês just fix it. If you can fix it, I will listen to what you have to sayÄ.The minute you start pointing and saying that person is a rapist and a murderer, it pisses me off because Iêve been a part of that when they just use a blanket statement to talk about black people or when they use a blanket statement to talk about white people or women or any other group. I donêt think thatês America. I donêt want it to be America. title: Donald Trump Breaks New Record
text: Liberals have been waiting for GOP-frontrunner Donald Trump to fall out of the leading position for some time now, but according to new reports from The Week, it looks like Trump has it in the bag.–Trump not only could winãhe could win more decisively than any non-incumbent Republican contestant for the nomination since the dawn of the modern primary system,” one analysis said.And while polls in the primaries arenêt always accurate, they do give a strong representation of how votes will pan out on Election Day.Trump has been leading the New Hampshire polls by double digits since August of last year. Ted Cruz. If Cruz were to come out on top in Iowa, The Week notes that it –could be an unwelcome indication of whatês to come for him.” The article noted that Iowa voters often donêt select the presumptive GOP nominee.For the rest of the country, there is a very real chance that they will be voting in Trumpês favorãand by a landslide.What do you think about Trumpês poll numbers?

title: Trump Generously Repays Couple Who Helped Him When Limo Broke Down
text: The liberal media likes to portray GOP front-runner Donald Trump as a ruthless and money-hungry businessman with very little heart. But stories continue to surface proving that Trump has been using his wealth to better the world as far back at the early 90s, before he even thought of running for president.Take this story from 1995, for instance, when Trump was traveling on a New Jersey highway and his limousine got a flat tire. A passing motorist stopped to help the businessman. Trump asked how he could repay the man for lending a hand, to which he replied that Trump could send his wife a bouquet of flowers.Trump did send the bouquetãbut he went beyond that. With the flowers was a note that said –Weêve paid off your mortgage.”That story has been reported on before, and it highlights Trumpês true generosityãsomething that the media often likes to avoid.–I got to know Donald Trump after he spoke at Liberty in 2012,” Jerry Falwell Jr., President of Liberty University told Hannity. –I learned so much about him that the public never hears.”–Right after he visited here last time, I called him about a large Christian ministry in another state that needed some help,” Falwell continued. –I learned within a day or two he had donated $100,000 dollars of his own money.”What do you think? title: Donald Trump Donates 20k To Family Being Foreclosed On
text: The liberal media has been determined to portray Donald Trump as a selfish, scamming businessman. Leonard Dozier Hill III was facing the heartbreaking decision of selling the farm that his family had lived on for more than three generations.–That morning, it was going to be auctioned off at the courthouse steps, so he committed suicide,” Betsy Sharp, Hillês daughter, told reporters.Hill did not realize that by taking his own life, he would be acting outside of the familyês insurance policies. Local residents used the incident as an example of what the bank was doing to farmers.That is when Donald Trump caught wind of the situation and decided to get involved.Trump donated $20,000 to help put a stop to the initial foreclosure, and he even arranged for the family to make a round of talk shows in order to raise the rest of the money they needed.–I said to the guy, •You listen to me. If you do foreclose, Iêll bring a lawsuit for murder against you and your bank, on the grounds that you harassed Mrs. Hillês husband to his death,ê” Trump later wrote of an interaction with the banker.Trump and another wealthy businessman eventually partnered to pull together the rest of money that the donations couldnêt.What do you think? title: What Donald Trump Just Did Has Obama Absolutely FURIOUS
text: According to recent reports, a House bill designed to punish cities that refuse to enforce federal immigration law just passed. Failure to do so would result in the loss of federal law grants. The bill was voted on across party lines.–I think we can all agree that any state or locality must comply with the lawãand they are required to coordinate and cooperate with the federal government,” Representative Duncan Hunter of California stated. –If an arrest is made, the federal government should be notified. The fact that San Francisco, Los Angeles and other cities disagree with the politics of federal enforcement doesnêt mean they should receive a pass to subvert the lawÄAnd if they do, there needs to be consequencesãand the way we impose those consequences is by hitting them where it hurts. In the pocketbook.”The bill was passed following the random murder of 32-year-old Kate Steinle by an illegal immigrant.Opponents of the bill have called it the –Donald Trump Act.” Pelosi deemed the bill a –wildly partisan, misguided bill that second-guesses the decisions of police chiefs around the country about how to best ensure public safety.”Earlier, a separate and comparable legislation called the Protecting American Lives Act passed in the House.
